I am an avid photo buff and in retirement do a lot of traveling and love taking lots of pictures.I am very very satisfied the the FZ18k.

Reviews.Title: Happy so far with DMC-FZ18
Reviews.Author: NY Senior
Reviews.Content: One month is too short a time to really know a camera.  But, so far, I'm very pleased with the images from this Panasonic ultra zoom.  My goal was to own a camera with a longer zoom.  I read many reviews (pro and user) of all of the ultra zoom cameras and the Panasonic seemed to be overall the best rated for the money.  I haven't fully explored all of the settings but even the images I've taken with the camera on auto have been very good. Six months from now I may have a different opinion, but this Panasonic was an excellent choice and best overall value.  Amazon had the lowest price and free shipping (prime). I received the camera the day after I placed the order.

Reviews.Title: Panasonic FZ18
Reviews.Author: Ankit A. Desai
Reviews.Content: An excellent product with a very powerful optical zoom. Pictures came out very well however other cameras do provide better image stabilization than this camera.  I would encourage buyers to actually hold and see this camera in store before buying it online.  Other than that this is a great camera for beginners to intermediate users.  Some pictures do show some image noise but that's generally the case with many other cameras. Tons of features if you know how to use them!  Read the MANUAL!!

Reviews.Title: Great Camera!
Reviews.Author: E. R. Grigorian
Reviews.Content: This is a great camera with lots of features. I love the "iA" (intelligent Auto" feature: automatic face recognition, automatic scene recognition and automatic exposure. The advanced optical image stablization is much better than before. This camera makes it hard to take a bad picture.I used to own a Panasonic Lumix DMC-FZ20 and loved the picture quality with it. Broke my heart when I accidentally dropped it and broke the lens. Wasn't sure if I would find another camera as good as that, but so far I have loved the DMC-FZ18! My wife actually likes it better since it is smaller and weighs less.I would highly recommend the DMC-FZ18 for the amateur photographer to the advanced photographer.

Reviews.Title: Great Camera, BUT....
Reviews.Author: Tahir J. Naim
Reviews.Content: if you already own the FZ7 you may not want to upgrade.  I bought the FZ18 for the 50% greater zoom, but as you can see from the 2 bird of paradise pix I've posted, there does not seem to be any difference between the two cameras at full zoom.  I used a tripod and just switched out the cameras so the distance was the same.  I did the same to obtain the pix of the sandhill cranes at a much greater distance.  Yet the field of view whether at 12X for the FZ7 or 18X for the FZ18 is the same!  With that result I am returning this camera as the RAW feature and video improvement are not enough for me.  That should not stop you, however, from buying this camera or a FZ7 if you want something half the size of a DSLR that will take awesome pix and fit in your fannypack.So if you're looking for a great camera starting out I highly recommend the Lumix series (you might be able to find the FZ7 new for $100 or so less than this camera), but if you're thinking of upgrading from a FZ3 or better, then I'd hold off for another iteration or so.

Reviews.Title: Panasonic Lumix FZ28 Coming Soon!
Reviews.Author: Frederick W. Chapman "Consultant/Scientist at...
Reviews.Content: After reading a great many enthusiastic reviews of the FZ18 on Amazon, I decided to buy one myself.  I was just about to order it when I heard from Gordon Laing (who writes superb professional reviews on his outstanding Camera Labs website) that it is soon to be replaced with the FZ28!  The July 21, 2008 press release on the Panasonic USA website says the FZ28 will be available in August.  You can pre-order it from Amazon right now:Panasonic DMC-FZ28K 10MP Digital Camera with 18x Wide Angle MEGA Optical Image Stabilized Zoom (Black)I found detailed specifications and some early reviews of the FZ28 on the web, and it has a number of significant improvements:  an auto focus tracking mode for taking action shots (sports, children, pets, wildlife), the ability to zoom while recording video, an even wider angle lens, a bigger LCD display, and a 10 megapixel resolution.  (For detailed manufacturer specs, see the Panasonic UK website or the Digital Photography Review website.)The release of the FZ28 means the FZ18 should come down significantly in price.  If you don't need the new features of the FZ28, the new lower prices on the FZ18 will make it an even greater value than it already is.  How great a value is the FZ18?  Gordon Laing's professional review gave the FZ18 his highest rating and described it as the best ultra zoom currently available (as of October 2007).  Whichever camera suits your needs and budget, it's clearly to your advantage to wait until the FZ28 comes out before you buy either one.I realize that this announcement is not really a customer review, but I was so glad for timely news of the FZ28 that I just had to pass it on to other potential buyers of the FZ18.  I think the FZ28 will be well worth the wait, and I promise to post a review of the FZ28 once I have it in my hot little hands!UPDATE (9/28/2008):  Much to my surprise, the release of the FZ28 caused the price of the FZ18 to go UP, not down!  You can now buy a new FZ28 for significantly less than the price of a new FZ18.

Reviews.Title: Very Good at this price
Reviews.Author: Jaffrey W. Ali "Relentless Pursuit of Technology"
Reviews.Content: PROS:1. Nice long zoom2. Optional lens (fish eye, wide angle) can be had for cheap (I got mine for $30 each!!!!)3. Solid picture quality (formatted for viewing on HDTV)4. Anti-shake works well5. Excellent battery life.CONS:1. Digital noise on zoomed pictures2. Little slow to respondOverall, very satisfied after 6 months of use.

Reviews.Title: WOW!! Great camera for the price
Reviews.Author: Jo
Reviews.Content: This camera produces the best quality pictures when used in regular light conditions. During the night mode the pics are good and not that great compared to day time. The IA mode helps beginners like me to avoid hand shake. The long zoom 18X is very clear and crisp. Overall i am very happy with this FZ18 model and recommend it for any one who is looking for a wide zoom with good quality pictures and easy to operate..

Reviews.Title: All well except Noise Reduction and Videa Sound Quality
Reviews.Author: kc
Reviews.Content: This camera has every feature that I wanted: Super Zoom, Wide Angle, High Resolution, Image stabilization, Raw mode and decent pricing.  After researching for a pre SLR camera for a few months, I have finally decided on the FZ18.Surely the super zoom and wide angle have blown me away initially.  But, I was very disappointed with the noise reduction algorithm.  One can clearly see the excessive noise reduction Panasonic has applied to especially when compared to the Raw image side by side.  I have used a Canon S50 for the last 5 years and have expected to be blown away by this camera.  The image just does not have the fidelity as my good old Canon S50 delivers.The Leica lens delivers, you can see that from the Raw images.  But, I just couldn't take the NR and couldn't process every single Raw image after the fact either.  It was especially bad on the eyes area.  NR can be set in custom mode, but that made all the default shooting modes useless.The video sound quality is disappointing too, again when compared to the outdated Canon S50.Well, I have a couple more days to decide whether I want to return it.  I am hoping I can find some miracle.  I really wanted to keep this camera especially I don't think Canon S5 IS or Nikon P80 meets my needs.  Wish me luck...

Reviews.Title: Great Camera
Reviews.Author: K. J. Sayler "KJS"
Reviews.Content: I'm not a huge camera buff.  I got this as a gift for my wife.  She was coveting a relatives' huge DSLR, but after seeing how expensive and bulky they are she got discouraged and gave up.  This camera was the perfect compromise.  We have had great luck with it.  She is very happy with the quality of the photos that we now get over our our old pocket size camera.  The zoom has really extended her reach.  And I am amazed at how much more affordable and portable it is than the big cameras.

Reviews.Title: great camera for the money
Reviews.Author: Terry Lucht
Reviews.Content: I have had many digital cameras and have always been annoyed that in very bright situations you have a hard time seeing and composing your picture. You had 2 choices compose your picture through the rear LCD that some times you had a hard time seeing or through the view finder that did not show much other than if your picture fit in the black lined box and you had no idea at what zoom level you were at. I wanted a camera with a through the lens viewfinder, a good lens (you can't beat Leica), at least 8mp, relatively small and something that was affordable.  This camera fit my criteria, takes great pictures and so far I am very pleased with my purchase.

Reviews.Title: Lumix DMC-FZ18K is a winner
Reviews.Author: Ruth Waterman "Ruth"
Reviews.Content: I have had my Lumix DMC-FZ18K for two weeks now. I received my camera just in time for a local festival that my dauhter was in. The town celebrates tuplips and the school dresses in Dutch costumes and dance for a week. Tourist come from all over. I didn't have time to learn how to use the manual features so I mostly used the IA mode. It does a wonderful job of color saturation and clarity. I was also impressed with the lack of shutter lag, very quick. This is by far the nicest camera I have owned. I used the sports action for when they were dancing and I got some amazeing pictures. Be careful with using the sun sheild, don't use it on wide angles. I have pictures with the sheild in the corners of my the pictures.I also used the video to caputre some of the dancing.The videos are good but not super, but I got the camera for still pictures and the video is a bouns. I played very qucikly around with the macro and I am again amazed with the quailty of the photos. When I put them on my computer and enlarge them I find very little noise. I have a lot to learn about this camera as there are many features that I just need to sit down and learn but all in all for this kind of a camera I am very happpy with it. The only negetive thing I can say is that it feels plasticy and kind of cheap, but on the other hand it is light and I am a female with samll hands. I am going to try to add some photos to the site.

Reviews.Title: Meets every expectation
Reviews.Author: T. Hunter
Reviews.Content: No camera is ever going to take Pulitzer Prize winning photos 100% of the time, but this one is amazingly close.  I absolutely love this camera!!!!  I researched my purchase by reading the reviews and looking at customer images for some 20-odd cameras from different manufacturers.  Majority of the time my research led me right back to the Panasonic Lumix line of cameras.  I asked a few friends who are photo enthusiasts and they all seemed to point in the same direction.  I finally decided to purchase this one after narrowing down my choices (a major feat for me) to three different cameras and realizing this was the only one of those 3 that had an actual battery pack.  After using my other camera for the last three years and watching it eat 4 AA batteries at a time I couldn't help but to refuse to purchase another battery muncher.  I was willing to spend the extra for an backup battery pack so I didn't have to worry about fumbling around with all the AA's. This camera lasted through about 300 or so photos taken at max resolution and about 10 minutes of video shooting.  I'm not sure if those numbers are right, but I definately used the mess out of it playing around and it lasted through about 4 hours of play.  Surprisingly this camera (even though it's about 50% larger than my other) is fairly light and fits nicely in your hands.My husband is now telling me that I am rambling on about a camera that I've only had for a little over 24 hours so I will stop here and let the photos show the quality of this camera.  I love this camera and definately would recommend it to any one who asks!

Reviews.Title: Good camera for a little money
Reviews.Author: Nazar Gargol "Nazar Gargol"
Reviews.Content: I've been using this camera for 2 month, and I can say that this camera is just perfect for outdoors. I gave 4 stars because it doesn't have a good cuality pictures in a little light.

Reviews.Title: Best of the Ultra-Zoom category!
Reviews.Author: Andres Munera
Reviews.Content: I did some research reading expert reviews and it always scored higher than it's competitors.I've had the camera for 3 weeks and it's performance is in all sense up to my expectations.  It's fast, has a great optical zoom, and takes great pictures.

Reviews.Title: Digital Camera
Reviews.Author: Inquisitive "Bruce"
Reviews.Content: Got the camera with quick 2 day shipping.  Details of pictures are phenomenal.  Easy use in "IA" mode, no special skills required.  No flash unless you manually flip it up(This is good).  Unbeleivable detail at a block away.  Numbers on utility pole can be read with digital enhancement.  Please hold the camera still, the picture is as good as your stable hand.  Took some good pictures of the moon with manual adjustment of film speed, aperature and shutter speed.  It is not a single lens reflex, but getting close for the person on a budget.  Great fun!!

Reviews.Title: Review of Panasonic Lumix DMC-FZ18K 8.1MP Digital Camera
Reviews.Author: Daniel L. Manners
Reviews.Content: Awesome camera.  Excellent stabilization feature.  Used it for Christmas trip and my pictures taken in moving a horse drawn carrage over cobblestone roads are crisp and clean. Professional quality pictures without the "professional" price tag.

Reviews.Title: Best & Most Reliable Camera I've Ever Owned
Reviews.Author: Sparkle "Sparkle"
Reviews.Content: I frequently check in here to see if the Panasonic Lumix DMC-FZ18 is still available. It is, and it's held it's value through the years. As it should.  Amazing camera! I've owned mine since 2008. Purchased new. I've never had a moments trouble with it. It has a nice sturdy feel to it, and it takes amazing pictures! I've had more advanced photographers view my pictures and ask what camera I was using. They couldn't believe I didn't have an pricey SLR.  Amazingly clear pictures.  I use this camera almost daily, and I am tempted to buy another one just in case this particular model is discontinued. I've had several other brands of cameras over the years---but, this brand & model is by the far the best.

Reviews.Title: Great Super-Zoom Camera
Reviews.Author: Chalko
Reviews.Content: This is an excellent Super-Zoom camera.Obviously as stated in the description of the camera it zooms up to 18 times optical zoom.  This is an exdraordinary amount of zoom and still takes very sharp photos at this zoom due to the image stabilization.  For even more stability, you can easily use a mini tripod (which are very easy to carry around with you) as this camera is light enough to use with a mini tripod.I did a great amount of research when I bought this camera and it easily got the best reviews.  Image quality is excellent and the range on this camera is huge.  The lens goes from an equivalent 28mm to over 500 mm.Build quality of this camera is great...my 1 year old son has got his hands on this camera on many occassions and it has withstood the abuse that he has given this camera without any problems whatsoever.Battery life is also pretty good to above average.  It will take several hundred photos on a single charge.It is a little bigger than the average point and shoot, but definitely a whole lot easier to carry around than an SLR...it is an excellent camera for those who want more functionality and control of their photography but don't want to go up to an SLR camera.It even allows you to shoot in RAW, which is pretty rare for a point and shoot camera!!

Reviews.Title: A great camera for all but the professionals!
Reviews.Author: Greg Simpson
Reviews.Content: This is my third superzoom camera and it is wonderful.  The outdoor shots are perfect, indoor shots are great and even the indoor pictures in lowlight using the zoom (these are the toughest to get good results) come out very acceptable, and the video is as good as it gets.  Its not perfect but what is.  There is some shutter delay using the flash in the auto mode (just like most digital cameras), and you can't zoom while taking a video.  The video zoom has been resolved with the new FZ28.I have owned two cameras in the Canon S series of superzooms and was very happy with them, but I like this even better.  Before you buy this model check out the FZ28 - it has some improvements that may be important to you.  However, if there is a significant price difference, I am sure you will be pleased with the FZ18.

Reviews.Title: Perfect for when weight matters
Reviews.Author: H. Gordon
Reviews.Content: I also own a Nikon digital SLR.  I bought this camera to take on a hunt in Alaska.  I was concerned about the bulk and weight of my SLR, lenses, etc.  What first caught my eye about this Panasonic was the 18x capability, which gives you 28mm to 504mm (in 35mm equivalent) in a small and light package.  The camera did not disappoint.  I was able to get a lot of great shots: from zooms to panoramas, under varying light conditions (I didn't try anything faster than ISO400).  The resolution is great:  I can blow up my pictures and they still look good.  To top it off, you can shoot video with it also (30 fps), in either 4:3 or 16:9 aspect ratio.I had also bought and charged two spare batteries (no place to charge batteries in the field north of the arctic circle...).  Didn't touch either one.  I shot 250 pictures and around 20 minutes of video over the course of 8 days in the field and only took my first battery down to one bar.For you ultra-serious camera geeks: Is it a full SLR?  No.  Is the zoom as good as an SLR with a telephoto lens?  No.  Is it an HD camcorder?  No.But for you hunters, hikers, campers, outdoorspeople, or anyone concerned about bulk & weight, this camera can't be beat.

Reviews.Title: What an AMAZING CAMERA!
Reviews.Author: John-boy NW Ark
Reviews.Content: My wife and I purchased this camera as we both loved our current 5MP point and shoot Nikon but wanted a BIG ZOOOOM so we could expand into nature and bird photography.  We didn't want or have a lot of money to spend for a DSLR body and THEN even more for one of those big zoom lenses.  This camera have an unbelievable zoom and the stabilization feature at full zoom is remarkable!I'm my opinion this camera fits the niche between point and shoot and DSLR perfectly and ESPECIALLY great considering the price point--less than $300!  We couldn't find a DSLR body for that price, and to find an 18x zoom lens...well we laughed ourselves right off the website when we saw the prices!We were very impressed by the quality feel/construction.  It is very easy to use right out of the box--and the auto picture setting selects the perfect exposure 9 out of 10 times.  We have taken thousands of pictures--the burst mode is phenomenal and there are many of manual options/controls for when/if you want to take the next step.Another nice feature is this camera can accept filters (46mm) which expands its versatility and reduces the need for excess photo-editing afterwards.I also really like the fact that the camera can take pictures in RAW format as well as RAW + JPEG which means you get a picture in both formats...just fantastic really and a feature we did not find available in competitors.I would highly recommend getting the biggest memory card you can afford as well as a couple of extra batteries - for those all day photo safaris/excursions.This camera does not disappoint!

Reviews.Title: Panasonic Lumix DC-18K Digital Camera
Reviews.Author: Robert Till "Bob Till"
Reviews.Content: I used this camera for a family reunion. I took over 80 photos for the reunion and the battery still showed a full charge.  Most of the photos were excellent.  If they wern't it was because I'm still not used to pressing part way down to focus.  When I do the photos are great!  Ive taken moon photos using the manual and auto focus.  The auto focus as expected  does not always work for a moon photo, especially for a near full moon. The close ups are great for flowers and animals.  I love the zoom.  I've taked great still photos of my grandchildren diving into the pool using the burst mode. It stops them in mid air.

Reviews.Title: Lumix DMC-FZ18K
Reviews.Author: J. B. Stein "Jack"
Reviews.Content: I've had this camera for over a month, have taken over 1000 pictures with it and I'm happy to say I like the camera.  It is easy to use, simply put it in automatic mode and it takes nice pictures.  The zoom is incredible, almost should be illegal.  There are plenty of settings you can change, some can be a little confusing to find at first, but once you learn how things are set up in the menus, everything is easy to get at.  I'm a bit of a negative person so it is easier for me to cite some negatives but before I do, this camera is almost perfect for the amateur photographer, and I would recommend it highly.This camera is not an expensive SLR and the pictures are a bit grainy, particularly at full zoom.  I'm not talking blur, which the built in image stabilization handles well, just a tad grainy.  Shooting at 100 asa gets the best results. One important thing I didn't find out until AFTER I bought the camera is it will NOT use an SD card of 4 gigs or more UNLESS it is an SDHC card.  I had ordered a 4 gig SD card when I ordered the camera because my computer wouldn't read the SDHC format.  Anyway, works great with the 4 gig SDHC card which holds around 1000 pictures at full resolution (not raw of course). I mentioned the zoom is SUPER and it is, however it is a bit touchy to control and it's easy to over zoom when taking portraits.  A SLIGHTLY slower zoom would probably be a good idea.I had thought about getting an expensive SLR but I owned a film SLR years ago and not being a professional, I never bought additional lenses for it anyway, and a lot of the features I never used enough to get comfortable with, so I left that on automatic most of the time.  I figured why put all sorts of cash into a camera that you need to buy a separate lens for zoom and close ups?Anyway, you can read reviews of this camera all over the place, and for the most part, they are accurate.  I know I'm happy with my purchase, and recommend it to anyone looking for a nice camera at a reasonable price.

Reviews.Title: Battery LIfe
Reviews.Author: Tommy M. Earley "Travler"
Reviews.Content: The camera is all they say it is for the most part.  The zoom is great, and the picture quality is very good.  The display is intuitive, but the LCD is hard to see if you try to elevate the camera to take a shot over the crowd.  I would buy this camera again.  I found one major draw back and that was the claim, that the supplied battery gets 400 pictures.  I took 200 pictures on a full change and the battery was about to give out on me after only 200 shots with  maybe 30 using a flash.  You will want a back up battery if you take a lot of shots with this camera.

Reviews.Title: a great choice
Reviews.Author: alsey
Reviews.Content: I've had this camera now for 1 wk and taken close to 1000 shots and very pleased with the results. Depending on the user you can let it fully take charge and do all the work, you can get partially or fully involved too. Either way the buttons/knobs are placed just right so you can tweak settings easily and quickly with your eye still on the subject. So why did I chose the Lumix?...well initially I thought about the Sony H50, it had a few nice gimmicks like Nightshot and flip out screen but frankly I couldn't see much practical use of those. The zoom of 15x put it in a league below(afterall that's what we want a big zoom for), though in precision mode you can increase zoom to 30x...thats 15x optical and 2x digital also in smart mode you could go up 81x but only in vga. My girlfriend has a W120 with 4x zoom, in smart mode it can go up to 19x in vga, just a look at that quality tells me 81x vga pix will be totally unusable. Compared to the Lumix's 72x at 8mp, 92x at 5mp and 115x at 3mp and the Sony was eliminated...FYI I've taken hundreds of shots now with full optical and digital zoom at all resolutions, they are very good, sure at the limits they aren't razor sharp but that's to be expected.Nikon's P80 was also in the running, but I heard that the threads on it's lens were just cosmetic, also that there were no filters available or intended. This for me put the P80 behind the Lumix.My other choices were the Olympus SP570 and SP560, both felt very good ergonomically in my hand, and quality grip too. They did feel more chunky in the hand then the lumix(note: the lumix feels light too).I wasn't keen on the zoom ring around lens barrel and it felt un-responsive when I tried it, so SP560 was bettered placed because it's zoom ring was like the Lumix. However both olympus models don't have threads on the len barrel so like the p80 can't use filters to even protect then lens. I'd seen a few custom adapters on the net and unfortunately they appear like a hat rim sitting on the end of the extended lens barrel, not a pretty sight.Ok so I could live with no lens protection if the reviews gave it higher marks in picture,noise quality than the Lumix. Well after reading scores of reviews, the Lumix was superior across the whole focal range and ISO range. Sure ther's noise at high end ISO and low light but it's not as bad as the competion.The reviews along with my earlier observations made the Lumix an easy choice. The fact that the manufacturers didn't even consider threads on the lens barrels tells me that their models are really just fancy advance point and shoots and not bridge cameras like the Lumix...but that's just me.....enjoy!!!!

Reviews.Title: Great compact body with huge zoom range
Reviews.Author: Gregory W. Pedlow "Historian"
Reviews.Content: This is a great compact digital camera with a super zoom range from a true wide angle to a very long telephoto.  I took it on a trip to Utah recently visiting various national and state parks and took some great photos.  It was small and light weight enough that I took it on lots of hikes where weight was a factor.  I must admit, however, that my heart still belongs with the older brother of this camera, the Panasonic Lumix DMC-FZ50, which I also took on that trip.  Even though the FZ-50 is larger and heavier and has a less extensive zoom range (12x instead of 18x), it was my camera of choice because of its manual zoom, which is so much easier to adjust precisely to the size you want instead of a thumb switch like on most other digicams, including the FZ-18, and also it has the great moveable LCD screen, allowing you to take overhead or down on the ground close-ups with ease.  I do recommend the FZ-18 for those for whom size and weight are a factor, but I also suggest that you consider the older FZ-50 if you can find one.

Reviews.Title: view of Panansonic camera
Reviews.Author: Bordeau "nbordeau@hotmail.com"
Reviews.Content: I bought the camera because my daughter also has a older model and she loves it!!I took her camera to Ireland last year and got fantastic pictures.It is easy to operate and the results are terrific!!!

Reviews.Title: Travel around the world with ZF18
Reviews.Author: Oscar Lacarra Palomino
Reviews.Content: Hello, I am moving around the world with the backpack to shoulder in Hong Kong decided to buy the FZ18, as they often need more zoom, and it was an ideal solution because it had the benefit of a reflex, even shooting in RAW, a price and weight / volume reduced.I am very happy with the camera.I invite you to see the photographs that I made with the camera on my blog.Http://davidlacarra.blogspot.com/

Reviews.Title: Reasonable alternative to digital SLR
Reviews.Author: R. M. Szabo
Reviews.Content: This camera is better than average point and shoot but don't expect the picture quality of an old style film  SLR. It's worth what it costs but it will not knock your socks off. Panasonic doesn't provide or offer a proper fitting case for this model. I bought the Lowepro mini which works well and I'm very happy with but it would still have been nice to have a perfect fitting case for the camera alone.

Reviews.Title: Very pleased
Reviews.Author: J. E. Leslie
Reviews.Content: My initial wants were a small digital,4X(or more) telephoto,2.5+LCD camera. After considerable research i determined that my wants were answered with the DMC-FZ18. Very impressed with the picture and telephoto results. The larger size is compensated by the overall construction and capabilities. I am a novice photographer and i am really enjoying this camera

Reviews.Title: Good buy
Reviews.Author: K. Lengauer
Reviews.Content: I bought the camera a month ago..... I was surprised how light the camera was, but most of all... I was really impressed by the lense - fantastic zoom. Easy to use - great quality pictures!

Reviews.Title: Great Super Zoom
Reviews.Author: JeffW
Reviews.Content: The FZ18 is by far the best camera that I have used so far. It has plenty of features for the novice to the more advanced photographer. I have taken a fair amount of pictures so far and all have turned out great. If you are looking for a great super zoom camera, pick this one up you will not be sorry.

Reviews.Title: Great camera!
Reviews.Author: Kevin J. Gallagher "kjg"
Reviews.Content: I recently bought this camera and I have found it easy to use with great results!  I can't wait to buy the attachment lense so that I can do close up photos (food shots).I am impressed with the telephoto lense and the clarity of the pictures.  So far, I am a happy camper!

Reviews.Title: Reality lives up to marketing hype
Reviews.Author: fCh "fCh"
Reviews.Content: This camera is a treasure!  Indeed, how many times is it that reality lives up to marketing hype, especially in the field of consumer electronics?  Panasonic advertises 18x zoom, Leica lens, optical stabilization and intelligent scene selection and this camera delivers on each one of the above.  Additionally, consider the price and ask yourself why haven't bought it yet!Pros:*Stabilization--go with the zoom all the way to 18x and check for yourself, you'd have to discard only about 25% of the pictures due to motion-blur;*Nice/bright saturated colors (this is so especially in the outdoors);*Leica lens;*Huge zoom; it's not often that you need to go all the way, but when you do it's there;*Auto mode that works (intelligent selection);Future areas for improvement:*Swiveling LCD;*Manual zoom;*RAW;*and, for daydreamers now, more serious feel than the current plasticky one of the body.Then again, taking these areas for improvement at face value, isn't this what the next step up is supposed to do (for a mere hundred bucks more, check out FZ50)?

Reviews.Title: Panasonic Megazoom
Reviews.Author: Dale Banford
Reviews.Content: DMC-FZ18K; I LOVE this camera. The "K" is for black body, "S" for silver. My wife never could take good pictures as she can't hold still, but with this; sh'e as good as me. Large view screen. I recently took it to my daughter's college graduation. One lady looking at my camera, ask if I was a profesional. Anyway; I could use that 18x zoom; to really get her up close & personal. Easy to use; yet plenty of gadetry to play with if you want. I'm amazed at all this camera can do. I think it's smarter than me, yet as simple as you need it to be. It will do everything itself; if that's what you want. Had a Olympus 8x zoom before which I liked, but no comparison to this.

Reviews.Title: Great camera, love the pictures.
Reviews.Author: Philip Foell
Reviews.Content: this camera works great (though I do need to look through the manual and find out how to turn off the constant beeps).  Pictures look great on the screen and once uploaded.

Reviews.Title: WOW what a camera!!!!!!
Reviews.Author: stuffy nose guy
Reviews.Content: I don't know a lot about the technical aspects of this camera, but I can tell you I have taken every type of shot I can think of. Nightime outdoor stuff: great. Inside the house: great. Outside detail stuff: great. And I love the rechargable batteries. Bought an extra battery for $6. Can take about 300 shots without having to change batteries. There are newer cameras, but nothing that can match the lens on this thing.

Reviews.Title: Great camera
Reviews.Author: Trottierb
Reviews.Content: This camera was way ahead of the other point and shoot cameras I have owned.  The reason I learned is the big Leica lens on it. I get the sharpness of a high priced DSLR for a fraction of the cost.

Reviews.Title: I own 4 of these cameras
Reviews.Author: Photocostumer
Reviews.Content: I love these cameras!!I own 4.I make my living with these from them.Simple,easy to use.Highly recommended!

Reviews.Title: Couldn't be happier
Reviews.Author: Expat
Reviews.Content: I have had this camera for nearly 2 years and I am still awed by the 18X Leica lens and the quality of images even when zoomed to the maximum optical zoom. I have been a photographer for a long time and still remember that with my old 35mm Nikon the 300 mm lens (not a Nikon because of the cost) was heavy, long and required so much light to be able to shoot at a reasonable shutter speed, it was often unusable. Those days are gone and this entire camera weighs only a fraction of what my old 300 mm lens weighed by itself. The lens is so fast that it can be used under otherwise questionable light, especially with the optical stabilization. It's true that the battery life is a small issue but everything else more than makes up for it.

Reviews.Title: Outstanding camera for the price!
Reviews.Author: T. Jen
Reviews.Content: I have had this camera (replacing FZ-8) for over a year now, so I can really say I have tested it and found it is the BEST super-zoom camera for the price unless you want to step up to a DSLR with bulky lense collections and pay a fortune for them!I used it for snap shots during sightseeing, as well as semi-professional photos for architectural and interior design projects (I am a professional interior designer)....I especially like the "wide-angle" lense and the "raw/jepg" setting which can really produce professionally looking photos. The "raw" software included is very easy to use for higher-quality photos.The newer FZ-28 model basically is very similar to FZ-18, so it should be a good choice if you can get a good price....highly recommend it!

Reviews.Title: little warrior
Reviews.Author: roberto garcia "dino 246"
Reviews.Content: I will not sit here and dissect this camera from top to bottom, that is what the manufacturer's manual is for. I will say this, I have had an absolute blast with this camera. From portraits, panorama's and my forte macro world. This is a great bridge camera and I highly recommend it. If you are considering buying this camera don't hesitate, buy it and enjoy.

Reviews.Title: Good Buy for Money
Reviews.Author: Vivek Choudhary "VKC"
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera couple of months back as it was an economical wide angle with 18x zoom camera... I switched to this camera from my earlier Canon A560 point and shoot camera...Let me tell you my feelings with this product one by one...Image quality: good in day time / good light situation, colors are natural, though you can see few fringes where there is a radical change in LUX in a image.Dont use in low lights without flash(though after good amount of fiddle with this you can get good quality image)Noise is high after ISO400.You can record RAW images which is an added advantage.Build: Good to handle camera, Comfortable gripTechnology: Sensor not that great, Image processing is high making your images look blur at time or over smooth.I really miss USB 2.0.Image transfer rate is pathetic, so i use my sd card directly with my laptop.Battery life is good.Price: V goodValue for money: V goodPros:1. Excellent Natural colors(in good light)2. Very good clarity (less noise in day time)3. Fast acting zoom & Very Good Image stabiliserCons:1. lack of USB 2.02. High noise in low light condition or High ISO (>400)I will recommend this camera to people who does outdoor photography mostly in day time. For night dont forget to use the flash (only for parties or small distances).One problem I also faced that you can not use the zoom while taking movies. This camera will not work with AA batteries. But if you ask me how do I overall rate it then it is my final rating:1. Image quality: day time : 5/5  low loght 2/52. Noise again same as above including 2/5 at ISO>4003. Build 4/54. IS 3.5/55. Battery 4.5/56. Image Processing 4/57. Overall 4.5/5

Reviews.Title: Good camera
Reviews.Author: Grace "Grace"
Reviews.Content: I probably purchased too much camera. I researched cameras and thought this to be the best. But some of the features can be obtained when you print your digital photos from Walmart. I could have purchased a camera w/less features. I need to study to properly utilize and get the best benefit from this camera.

Reviews.Title: Wonderful camera
Reviews.Author: K. Russell
Reviews.Content: I just got back from a two week vacation in Alaska and I must say this camera is outstanding.  From wide angle views of the amazing scenery to getting close to the glaciers from a cruise ship this camera does it all.  The images are crisp and clear and the image stabilization works excellent.  For anyone looking for a good compromise for a digital SLR so you don't ned to carry additional lenses this is a great camera that you will be pleasently surpirsed by.

Reviews.Title: Impressive Camera!
Reviews.Author: Chris
Reviews.Content: Everyone that sees me with this camera is completely impressed when I tell them how much it cost. The pictures it takes are amazing. The 18x optical zoom gives you narrow depth of field for striking images, and the manual settings lets you take really cool long exposure shots.Definitely a step up from a regular point and shoot. I'd recommend this to anyone getting serious about photography that doesn't have six or seven hundred dollars to spend on an SLR kit.

Reviews.Title: more tha I expected
Reviews.Author: Alicia G. Silva
Reviews.Content: I asked a super knowledgable friend for a good camera for not a lot of money I am an interior designer and a Soccer mom. I needed versatility and quality for work and family life and this camera has it all. Of course my sons tell me how this works because it is more complicated than the regular click only cameras, but they are now also learning about the subtleties of going a step above, and the wonderful things you can do with a good camera It was a well worth buy.

Reviews.Title: love it for fast shots
Reviews.Author: L. Fuller
Reviews.Content: I wanted a nonSlR camera that would take fast shot to shots.  This camera is awesome.  There is virtually zero wait time between shots.  The burst mode is awesome.

Reviews.Title: Panasonic Lumix DMC-FZ18K
Reviews.Author: Papa
Reviews.Content: I purchased the Panasonic Lumix DMC-FZ18K as a replacement for my Kodak DX6490 which I purchased many years ago.  I like the styling of bridge cameras and use them when I don't want to lug a digital or film SLR and its accessories around.  Shortly after receiving the FZ18K I went on a cruise to Alaska where I took several hundred pictures with the camera.  It did a spectacular job.  Although I also had a DSLR with me, the size and capabilities of the FZ18K proved very valuable on some of the shore excursions where I had some limitations on how much I could carry.  I did a lot of research before I purchased the camera and found that I concur with all of the positive reviews I read.  The camera does have a lot of functionality that takes a bit of time to understand but it can also be used as a point-and-shoot.  If the camera has any negatives, to me, it would be the way the lens shade mounts and that it can't be reversed on the camera for storage and the battery life is considerably less than advertised.  Overall, I am extremely pleased with the camera and the internet purchase.

Reviews.Title: Amazing, lightweight, fast: brilliant!
Reviews.Author: EAB
Reviews.Content: This camera is a gem. It's lightweight and functional, with enough features to keep the more adventurous entertained, but also the capability to just point and shoot and get one amazing photo after another. It's a hybrid between point-and-shoots and DSLRs, and it does the job with finesse. Very rapid shutter speed, great location of controls, and consistent results. I took this camera to Alaska, and the 18X zoom was perfect for wildlife and aerial shots. I researched pretty extensively before buying, and this is the best camera of its kind for its price. I would highly recommend this camera to anyone looking for a step above a basic digital camera but just under a DSLR. No complaints; just amazing results.

Reviews.Title: Excellent camera!
Reviews.Author: B. Smith
Reviews.Content: I love this camera. I am a point and shoot kind of guy. I like things easy, but usually with easy, you get subpar quality. This is not the case with this camera. It has a very good quality to it. Nice and sturdy outside. Beautiful pictures from inside. The 18x zoom is what I was looking for in a point and shoot and this takes nice pics fully zoomed out. It has good night settings and very good stabilization. I have not tried the video recording yet. I didn't buy it for that, since I have a Panasonic DV camera for that. It has all the manual seetings that you would need to go beyond point and shoot. So for anyone who wants a point and shoot that is just a notch below or maybe even on the same level as some D-SLR's, this one is a very good deal at such an excellent price. Oh by the way, maybe the battery life is not the greatest, so buy an extra battery. I bought one for $7.00. I bought an 8 gig SD card to go with it. It can hold over 3000 shots on the highest quality.

Reviews.Title: Great ultra-zoom digital camera
Reviews.Author: Camera buff
Reviews.Content: This camera is the size of a plain SLR, but much lighter.  It has just about every imaginable setting - in both automatic and manual modes.  Anti-shake technology, 18X zoom, 8.1 MP, Face Detection, multiple scenes, AE/AF, the list goes on.  For the money, this camera is a great deal.  If you're looking for a a point-and-shoot, this its it; if you want a semi-pro camera with advanced settings, this is it. Highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: I LOVE IT!
Reviews.Author: Moggy K
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera 6 months ago as a reward to myself. I am loving it! Its so much lighter than my Olympus SLR (that I've been clinging to since 1979). I'm big into birdwatching and I am loving the zoom capabilities. I am still learning new functions and capabilities on the camera but that keeps it interesting for me. I hope one day to be able to afford a Digital SLR, but in the meantime I am planning to purchase the extra telephoto and the close up lens soon. I highly recommend this camera!

Reviews.Title: Camera
Reviews.Author: C. Gonzalez
Reviews.Content: The camera is all I expected and more.  Easy to use, easy to figure out and so lightweight not to mention takes amazing pictures!  It stays with me everywhere I go because it is so easy and user friendly.

Reviews.Title: Awesome Camera!!!!
Reviews.Author: Melissa A. Defrancesco
Reviews.Content: This camera is simply amazing! If you are interested in a camera that is more than a simple point and shoot but not as complicated or difficult to carry around as an SLR, this one is perfect.  The camera is very small which makes it so easy to transport.  The picture quality is awesome for 4X6 (I haven't yet tried to make any larger prints).  Panasonic has a great menu system that is logical and very simple to use.  I am completely satisfied with this purchase and would highly recommend this camera.

Reviews.Title: All I wanted in a Digital Camera
Reviews.Author: Michael C. Bartmess "TechUser"
Reviews.Content: I have had three digital cameras, a Kodak back in 1996, an Olympus after that and this Panasonic.  This camera gives me everything I wanted.The camera housing is very sturdy. I take the camera everywhere and don't fear a little bumping around.  I take it hiking in teh mountains, casual walks, kayaking, kids soccer games.  performs like a champ.The pictures are great, the software works great, the LCD display on the back is almost as large as the device can hold, so only an extendable display would make it theoretically bigger. (Wouldn't that be a nice feature choice?)The camera comes on very quickly.  I feel spoiled by how quickly i can grab the camera, turn it on and shoot.  My Olympus was so slow to turn on and be ready.  You loose shots with a digital sometimes, the digital camera's biggest drawback.  But this DMC-FZ50 camera turns on in second.  The Olympus C-3030 zoom (recognizing it was last generation technology) also had a delay between pushing the shutter button and the camera collecting the image.  So it was virtually impossible to take picture of a child swinging or coming down a slide; you just didn't get the picture at the moment you wanted.  The data capture time to the focal plane array on this model has vastly improved.The thing has too many features to even talk about.  They all work.  i personally use very few of them.  The video capture is another feature that is vastly improved over what I experienced with my last digital camera, the Olympus.  It is a bit tricky on lighting with video but the sound that comes with the video is good and you can figure out how to get the lighting right if you mess around a little.  Anyway, if you want good video, capture it with a device made for that purpose.I bought two batteries and keep them both charged in my case when I'm going anywhere i expect to take a lot of pictures.  I haven;t timed the camera but I can't remember running out of battery power and have taken hundreds of photos on a vacation outing.I put an 8MB memory card in it, since memory is so cheap these days and I rarely even think about taking a second card with me.  If you're taking more pictures than this camera will hold on an 8GB card, you are missing the experience of the day with your face planted solely behind the camera.  Anyway, i haven;t counted the number of pictures I can take max but its a boatload.  Nobody who lived in the era of film cameras will ever complain about the number of photos you can take without loading another memory card.I think the camera's weigh feel good, the hand grip is substantial enough to make it easy to manage one-handed.One thing I don't like is how the sun shield attaches to the lense housing.  it seems to have been designed as an afterthought and doesn't fit well.  it always seems loose even if you tighten the thumbscrew used to hold it in place to its max tightness.I read some complaints about the lense cover before I purchased the DMC-FZ50 but I've had no problem with it.  It's leased and seems to stay in place alright.The displays can be a bit much to learn but that's simply because there are so many features.In regular sunlight the camera takes very stable pictures at full magnification.  The 18X zoom is awesome and having the ability to extend that electronically to 72X zoom withotu any additional lense is simple astounding.  However, don't expect crystal clear pictures at 72X extended zoom.All in all an excellent camera and for the price a real value.

Reviews.Title: Best 18X Optical Zoom Camera !!
Reviews.Author: Julio C. Genao "Kanival"
Reviews.Content: Best 18X Optical Zoom Camera !! The price is great for that kind of camera, looks like a professional camera ans the shots are great.

Reviews.Title: great camera ....
Reviews.Author: Michael Versteegen
Reviews.Content: I just got the Lumix DMC-FZ18K.this is a great camera with all the features you need. go for full automatic or chose manual settings if you are experienced and keen on special effects. The 18x zoom is fantastic. I did some sports pictures with the multi shot feature and they are just great. Definitely an alternative to a SLR camera.

Reviews.Title: How could it be any better?
Reviews.Author: Richard A. Hunsinger "Macro specialist"
Reviews.Content: Ok if you liked any of the previous FZ models, this is a big step up. By moving zoom power form digital, to optical, they improved focus, clearity, and shutter speed. Low light photography has improved, but as with all mega-zoom cameras is limited. The AI feature will take excellent pictures under most conditions. Ease of use has been upgraded. And now the addition of a wide angle lens has provided the option for panaramic pictures. There are few changes with this camera that have not improved it, so I have no real negative responses. My only gripe, and this appiles to both this, and and my previous FZ7, is the video recording function does not permit zoom during filming. But in all honesty if I wanted to make movies I would buy a video camera.

Reviews.Title: FZ18 Does it All
Reviews.Author: D-Day "june6th1944"
Reviews.Content: This was an upgrade from a 3-year old 4.2MP HP camera, and WOW this camera does everything!  The image stabilization is awesome, and the 18X zoom (504mm equivalent) reaches out.  My close friend returned his LZ10 he just bought and got one of these instead for he and his wife's upcoming trip to the UK and Germany.I'm just using the auto-functions right now, but you can customize manual settings to fit your needs better.  Taking the kids sports events has been great w/ the outdoor sports setting, again, the image stabilization is incredible and can focus on movements easily.

Reviews.Title: Better than the Great Reviews
Reviews.Author: P. Black "Born Aggie"
Reviews.Content: I recently bought this camera for my wife.  She loves it!!!!!!!Easy to use, rugged, light, and excellent features.  The features take some time to really understand, but she was able to take great pictures right out of the box.  The "Intellegent" picture mode is a must if you are zooming in 18x and not using a tripod.  Without it, you will not get a clear picture.  With it, every picture is crystal clear.My wife loves this so much she is already trying to figure out when she can go out to just take pictures of ANYTHING.  Pure excitement!!!

Reviews.Title: Panasonic DMC- FZ18
Reviews.Author: Nero62
Reviews.Content: I've had this camera about a month now and am very satisfied with my selection. This was a step up from my last digital camera so with all the options on it I'm still on a learning curve of what I can, and can't do. I find it is easy to operate and take excellent pictures, not to mention the owners manual is actually pretty simple to understand, which is rare with technical manuals.I would definitely recommend the DMC-FZ18 to any intermediate or advanced photographer. The 18x optical zoom has allowed me to take some pretty sweet close-ups of water fowl and wild life. Again I am completely satisfied with this camera.

Reviews.Title: Excellent product
Reviews.Author: JohnV
Reviews.Content: I was looking for a good compact camera with a decent lens and zoom.  This one is all that the blurb offers and the price is OK too.

Reviews.Title: Decent Superzoom
Reviews.Author: Stujoe
Reviews.Content: This is my second FZ from Panasonic. The other was the FZ7.The FZ18 is a decent camera. Keep the ISO at 100 or 200 and you won't have a lot of problems. At higher ISOs, it can develop splotchy yellow patches of noise that are pretty tough to remove in post processing. Lens is good but a little slow on the long end. Doesn't focus quite as well as the FZ7.Be aware of a 'Blue Band' issue with this model in low light, high contrast scenes. Do a search on google. Supposedly there is a fix for it from the mfr.

Reviews.Title: Great Camera
Reviews.Author: A. Greenamyre "mystical.pixie"
Reviews.Content: I just got my new camera yesterday (right on time) and it is in great condition. I already LOVE it!!! I highly recommended this product to any who is interested in a good camera. The Zoom is magnificent, the pictures are crisp and clear, the quality of the pictures are great, and there are so many fun things to play around with on the camera! Well worth the money!!

Reviews.Title: Amazing camera!
Reviews.Author: R. Albert "nature lover"
Reviews.Content: I already have a camera for which I paid 4x the amount paid for my Panasonic but still this last one is a far better product. So far, I'm glad I choose Panasonic.

Reviews.Title: Panasonic Lumix DMC-FZ18K
Reviews.Author: 19danny48
Reviews.Content: The very best camera I have ever owned. Very easy to use. Used daily in my job. Excellent photos. Very nice zoom. Flash is very good, long range.Light Weight. High quality. Very good price.

Reviews.Title: Panasonic Z18 Camera
Reviews.Author: Morles "Don"
Reviews.Content: Received the camera on the projected delivery date.  Have used it a couple of times and the result have been fine. Decided to buy another lithium battery as I felt that it ran down rather quickly even though I use the viewer rather than the LCD most of the time.  Two hour recharge, however, is good. Anxious to use it with its 504mm lens  in Costa Rica....the primary reason I selected this camera.

Reviews.Title: Great
Reviews.Author: Tomáš Babiak
Reviews.Content: The camera is great. I'm very satisfied with the image stabilization. Pictures taken taken in dark have some noise, but I knew about it before and it is not so bad.

Reviews.Title: Great camera if you want to avoid carrying a bulky SLR
Reviews.Author: D. Seltzer "daseltzer"
Reviews.Content: Although the quality is not exactly the same as an SLR, the pictures and functionality are great (a real upgrade from a snap and shoot).I read many reviews and the main reason why I bought this over an SLR is to avoid carrying a big bag everywhere I go (this one fits into a medium size camera bag).From the super zoom cameras, I picked the Lumix because of all the positive reviews I read everywhere.

Reviews.Title: ALL MY FRIENDS WANT ONE TOO!!!
Reviews.Author: Terra M. Bulle "CANDID SHOT"
Reviews.Content: I HIGHLY RECOMMEND THIS CAMERA. I HAVE NEVER PURCHASED A DIGITAL BEFORE. I COULDN'T FIND ONE AFFORDABLE WITH THE ZOOM I WANTED. I TAKE CANDID SHOTS WHEN NO ONE IS LOOKING. ALL OF MY FRIENDS LOVE THIS CAMERA AND THE PHOTOS IT PRODUCES. I WENT TO THE ZOO & TOOK AMAZING CLOSEUPS OF THE ANIMALS. "THESE SHOULD BE NATIONAL GEOGRAPHIC PHOTOS" IS A QUOTE. I AM NOT A PROFESSIONAL PHOTOGRAPHER BY FAR BUT THE QUALITY OF THE PHOTOS ARE. MORE EXPERIENCED DIGITAL CAMERA USERS TELL ME THIS CAMERA HAS MORE OPTIONS THAN I WILL EVER NEED. I HAVE NOTICED IT DEFIANTLY IS PACKED WITH OPTIONS. I AM STILL FIGURING OUT SOME OF THEM. I AM HAVING A SMALL ISSUE WITH SPEED. IE TOOK A PHOTO OF A 2 DAY OLD BABY ON BABY MODE- THE BABY MOVED IT'S ARM AND THE PHOTO WAS BLURRED... I SEEM TO HAVE TO PUT EVERYTHING ON SPEED MODE... (THE LITTLE GUY RUNNING)I JUST NEED TO READ THE MANUAL AND FIGURE IT OUT THOUGH. I ALSO RECCOMEND BUYING A 8GB SDHC CARD CLASS 6 TO GET THE HIGHEST USAGE/QUALITY ALSO AMAZON OFFERS AN EXTRA BATTERY FOR LIKE $3. I HAVE IT ALSO AND IT WORKS JUST LIKE THE FACTORY. VERY NICE TO HAVE 2 BATTERIES... BUY THIS YOU WILL LOVE IT!!
