Reviews.Title: No surprises
Reviews.Author: Ansel Adams
Reviews.Content: Reviews are pretty much right on.  Not great in low light.  Good outdoor camera.  Great zoom.  Lots of controls so it takes a while to get to know it.  Automatic features work well for point and shoot.  Battery life great.  I did not need spare while traveling in Europe.  Charger is small and runs on 220.  Camera fit in my winter overcoat pocket but it would have been easier to access hanging from neck strap.  Fun to play with given controls and capabilities.  I wish the EV compensation would reset to 0 after a shot instead of being remembered.  Take manual with you for the first trip or two.  Not 5 stars because of image quality.

Reviews.Title: Image quality isn't all that consistent
Reviews.Author: Daniel D. Miller "Daniel D. Miller"
Reviews.Content: I got this camera primarily for the long optical zoom; otherwise I have a FujiPix F30 that I'm completely happy with.  Unfortunately, even under good lighting conditions, the quality of the images at long zoom are mediocre at best.  I've tried playing around with the various sharpness/noise reduction/contrast settings which are recommended on various enthusiast sites, and I've shot both jpeg and raw, but none of these produce sharp, clear images with good resolution of details (for example, grasses just resolve as blurs, rather than being sharply resolved).  I suspect I should have stuck with a shorter-zoom model until the technologies get a little more mature...

Reviews.Title: A great buy
Reviews.Author: Ujwala Prabhu
Reviews.Content: Got this camera in Dec last year. The FZ18 is my 3rd digi cam after the nikon 5400 and canon sd400 and it's the best! It takes great photos, is light, has a fantastic 18X zoom and good image stablisation.  i just love it!  If you're ok with a slightly larger camera, this is the one to buy.

Reviews.Title: Question on correct UV Filter
Reviews.Author: Shaggs "MJV"
Reviews.Content: I had a previous review talking about the problem I was having getting the correct UV filter to attach right to the plastic filter ring. I have since removed the negative remark about the filter mount because a few people who knew more about the design said it should use a smaller filter then the 55mm filter I was trying to use. Could the people who responded to that previous review, or anyone who is familiar with the design,  respond to this review and tell us again what is the correct UV filer size to use with the Panasonic Lumix DMC-FZ18K plastic filter mount and what brand name filter would work best? It seemed like they said it was a 46 or 47mm filter. I was also wondering if that causes vegnetting while shooting at extreme wide angle using the smaller filter size? Any more information regarding buying filters for the camera would be appreachated. Thanks for your help.

Reviews.Title: It's perfect!
Reviews.Author: valerie de Marquette
Reviews.Content: I've had this particular camera  once before.  I am familiar with it which makes the learning curve non existent.  There were a few issues with the packaging but the owner of this store contacted me immediately to resolve the issue.  I also explained that I was in a hurry to get it since I was leaving the state for several weeks and needed it for my trip.  He told me that he would rush it out to me ASAP.. I received it 2 days later!  Thank you for your quick and courteous response!

Reviews.Title: Replacing another beloved camera
Reviews.Author: Kathryn L. Mcqueen "amazonwomyn"
Reviews.Content: This camera was stolen and I am replacing.  It is lightweight, has an excellent long range zoom and is easy to operate.  I love this point & shoot.

Reviews.Title: Great All-round Camera
Reviews.Author: M. G. Smith
Reviews.Content: I've used a lot of cameras, and this is one of the best all-round models I've ever used. Stills are sharp and clear with great color reproduction. Handling is very intuitive. The controls are well placed and the menus easy to navigate. Performance is god, with quick start-up, virtually no shutter lag, and quick, accurate auto-focus. The downside is the video. While it performs well, the video quality is less than optimum. If you're used to HD, it will seem downright primitive. But I've used the long zoom - which is excellent - to draw in scenes I'd never have gotten with a lesser camera. As with other "superzoom" cameras, the sensor is relatively small, but it gives good results nonetheless.

Reviews.Title: Great camera
Reviews.Author: Jeff Pastoor
Reviews.Content: This camera works great.  Picture quality is excellent, the 18x zoom is very fast, and there are settings for everyone.  You can keep it on Intelligent Mode for easy picture taking, or you can go fully manual and set everything the way you want, with many pre-sets inbetween (sports, scenery, night, etc).  The only down side is that my Smart phone is so handy so this phone doesn't get used as much as it should.

Reviews.Title: My longtime favorite.
Reviews.Author: Brittany Penn
Reviews.Content: This was a perfect replacement for my older camera of the exact same model I've had 5 years, this camera is extremely easy to use and the many useful settings work great with minimal or easy exposure tweaking, and the lighting settings are useful for different environments too. With a tripod, it can take some decent long exposures of a starry sky too (not crazy high quality there but works nicely enough to be a really cool thing to do!) It turns on and takes pictures and videos quickly and has good durability. (I took my old one on plenty of rainy stormy days and it was fine, just use common sense and try to treat it well) The picture quality, focus, & color is great to this artist's eye's (though I'm no photographer, just for fun and documenting neat things I see). The macro works well too for flowers and closeups and such. only downsides I can think of is that you can't zoom in or out while taking a video and the video, while great quality & good sound, is not HD like some newer camera models. I tried out a newer model but I was having too much trouble getting used to it as easily, this remains my faithful favorite for now. a charged battery can last a long long time, I charge it every few days if I use it somewhat often. if you have it on constantly snapping hundreds of pics all one day long, it may only last half the day at disneyland, so have an extra battery on hand. But I can easily have it last all day long and still take tons of pictures all day. it charges in a couple short hours.

Reviews.Title: Really Neat Camera!!
Reviews.Author: S. Henderson
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera to replace my GE X5. The Lumix, even though older, way out performs the newer GE. It takes nice macro pictures. The zoom is wonderful. I highly recommend this camera to those who want the easiness of point and shoot, but with a more professional look.

Reviews.Title: great camera
Reviews.Author: Francis Noone
Reviews.Content: Not really a talked about camera company but I've had three now and they are great products.  Would recommend to anyone.

Reviews.Title: Lumix 18x
Reviews.Author: Andrea Allen
Reviews.Content: This is a great camera ! I wanted something that was easy to use and a lot of zoom! The picture quality is good too.

Reviews.Title: Works great with only minor problems.
Reviews.Author: Sylvia Benitez "Tech Gal"
Reviews.Content: I'm a tech teacher for a high school and I've worked with lots of different cameras and the Panasonic Lumixes have always been my best buys for the price range.  My students love the built in zoom lens (no need to change lenses on the run) and they feel like they're using something more sophisticated than a basic point and shoot.  You also get a large number of pictures on one battery charge even if you constantly use the LCD.  The only cons I've found are that they have problems indoors with low artificial light.  If you don't watch what you are doing you end up with a lot of yellowed images.  I often have to adjust the white balance and iso settings.  You can't beat the Lumixes if you're trying to buy a versitile camera with zoom for under $300.

Reviews.Title: Great camera
Reviews.Author: Ricardo E. Hutchinson V
Reviews.Content: First i use the FZ8k, then this one(FZ18K), the camera take great pictures, i dont need photoshop to clean my pictures anymore.

Reviews.Title: best for entry level photographer hobbyist
Reviews.Author: G. BHIMAVARAPU "happy"
Reviews.Content: i got this camera as an entry level piece before i would get an slr. this is surely a dlsr replacement camera. reduces the hassels of lens and manual controls.. had a lot of good pics with it. it also has an awesome batt life, around 400 shots. this camera has convinced my friends around me to buy one as it had all they wanted.. way better than a point and shoot and a good one start before a Dslr

Reviews.Title: Great camera for the money
Reviews.Author: D. Grajeda
Reviews.Content: This camera has been a great for me. I use it to take pictures and I also use it to record video. I would recommend this camera.

Reviews.Title: A masterpiece in hand...
Reviews.Author: Holmes Uday "Holmes"
Reviews.Content: I've tried the earlier versions from Panasonic, but this is really ultimate... The product was delivered on the said time.I have a suggestion for Panasonic - to provide zoom functionality in video mode. If the camera had a zoom while taking a video, then there would be very few cameras to beat it.

Reviews.Title: FZ 18 review
Reviews.Author: KSF
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera to replace a smaller(in both size & megapixel) Olympus.  Before buying, I compared this with a Canon S5 IS.  I bought the Panasonic because of its many features, like 18x zoom, the menu ease of use, and its size.  It is a little lighter than others in its class.  The pictures I have taken are crisp, have wonderful color, and look as good developed as they do on the camera.  I am very happy with this camera and think I made a great choice.

Reviews.Title: Amazing handheld zoom!
Reviews.Author: W. Robert Shade III
Reviews.Content: This camera is amazing. I can take a handheld picture of a bird at 18X optical zoom, touch the zoom on replay of the image and it is still sharp boring all the way in! It makes me wonder if I will sell my Canon 100-400 image stabilization lens on E-Bay! It is so small I can carry it all the time for unexpected encounters and opportunities. There are so many (17) settings for special situations like Portrait, Scenery, Sports, Candlelight, etc. that I have not had opportunity to try them all.

Reviews.Title: Excellent ultra zoom point-and-shoot
Reviews.Author: Harvey Rarback "rarback"
Reviews.Content: We bought this as a replacement for a Canon S2 IS which kept malfunctioning and which Canon would not stand behind (but that is another review).  We've had the camera for two weeks and we have used it for a variety of shots.  It has performed well.  The advertised 18x zoom range is actually wider when you don't shoot at maximum resolution.The one downside we have found is that you cannot change the zoom or focus when taking video.

Reviews.Title: fantastic camera!!!
Reviews.Author: Robyn L. Young
Reviews.Content: I received this camera for my birthday. I am not a very experienced photographer. It was amazing how easy it was to take beautiful pictures. I took it on a trip to the San Juan Islands to try it out. I couldn't believe how great the pictures turned out and how fun the camera was to use. Its light and lots of fun. The zoom is wonderful. It makes one seem like a pro!

Reviews.Title: amazing...
Reviews.Author: Mustafa B. Akcura "baha akcura"
Reviews.Content: i bought that camera.300 dolar. maybe you can finf same camera another prise but, i need to say be careful,do not trusth anyone.I trusth amazon so ordered here.Camera is amazing..i get wonderful  foto`s . zoom is soo good useful and clean menu.maybe it`s best for semipro camera.

Reviews.Title: Maravillosa!!
Reviews.Author: Rafael Morales Rodriguez
Reviews.Content: Esta cámara cumple todas mis expectativas!Es la tercera cámara digital que poseo, estoy cambiando del point-and-shoot,hacia algo más complejo. Y la verdad que esta cámara tiene todas las buenas características de una DSRL pero a un precio más accesible.Lo más importante es que trae para formato RAW, que es la mejor forma para mantener la calidad de color de las imágenes y no complicarse pensando mucho en el balance de blancos y el ruido.Ya he tomado unas cuantas fotos y en verdad que el lente Leica hace que el desempeño de esta cámara sea mucho mejor.Lei muchas revisiones sobre esta cámara antes de adquirirla, y la verdad que no me ha decepcionado.Si alguien esta interesado en la fotografía y necesita de una cámara que posea muchas características para mejorar la composición de sus fotos, formato RAW, un super zoom, lente de alta definición, facilidad de uso y otras cosas más, sin tener que pagar cientos de dolares por una DSRL, les recomiendo ampliamente esta cámara o su nueva actualización, la DMC-FZ28.

Reviews.Title: Panasonic Lumix DMC-FZ18K 8.1MP
Reviews.Author: JLP "JLP"
Reviews.Content: I absolutely LOVE this camera and the pictures that it takes. It was recommended from my sister-in-law and believe me I will recommend it to everyone I know also.

Reviews.Title: EXCELLENT
Reviews.Author: Joe Liscano
Reviews.Content: The best camera for the price, It allows you to set up for semi professionals photos. Excellent purchase

Reviews.Title: Solid Camera
Reviews.Author: Paul D. Ramos
Reviews.Content: The Panasonic Lumix DMC-FZ18K is a solid camera that works very well. I love the focusing features of this camera and ultimately the final result - photos.

Reviews.Title: Excellent camera for zoom lovers
Reviews.Author: Ranganath Maligi
Reviews.Content: This is the best camera for optical zoom lovers.  This is the best in its class and delivers amazing results. I placed order with BuyNowInc they processed the order without any problems and this is the best service I have experienced in the recent past.The camera does its job very neatly and has some very amazing options. I am quite happy with the camera so far and the only thing that can be improved his zooming capability while taking motion pictures/movie.

Reviews.Title: Very Nice Camera
Reviews.Author: OldTooly
Reviews.Content: First let me say I bought this camera for my wife, not myself so I have not spent much time with it.  But the quality of photos taken by her has markedly improved with this Lumix.  The zoom is easy to use, the low light capability is also very good for indoor shots without the flash, giving a very natural color.  The battery life is also very good.  For around $300.00 USD it's a good value and should it last many years, it will be an excellent purchase.  It is so much nicer than my Samsung 8.1MPixel I am considering buying one for myself.

Reviews.Title: Panasonic FZ-18
Reviews.Author: K. Ponnan
Reviews.Content: This camera is well worth the price and is super versatile.  The fact that it allows manual control and shoots RAW images is a big plus.  Its also fairly lightweight and not too big in size.  The hood accessory included in the box is a nice addition.It would have been nice to be able to zoom in and out when using the video.  But one just has to predetermine the best focal length before pressing record.  It would also be nice to have some indicator of focal length in mm when using the zoom.  It gives an indication in 2X or 10X and so on.  That means you just have to do a quick mental calculation to get an equivalent 35mm focal length.  I noticed it has no macro mode on the dial.  Most cameras do so I would say its not a good thing.The toggle or joystick can be very useful once you get used to it.  The shutter lag time is almost unnoticable.  The 8.1 MP is for the 4:3 ratio mode.  When you shoot at 16:9 ratio or the 3:2 (SLR) ration, the MP count drops to 6 and 7 MP.  Not really a big deal but something you should note.The best thing is that this camera does so many things well and will make a great travel camera.

Reviews.Title: Excellent camera
Reviews.Author: Daniel Garcia "dagarciade"
Reviews.Content: It's an excellent camera, it have some details like the flashlight sometimes is covered by the lens when you use it close to the object, but in general review it's an excellent camera.

Reviews.Title: Panasonic Lumix DMC-FZ18K
Reviews.Author: S. CHAVIS
Reviews.Content: This camera is so exciting!  For the amateur photographer, this is fabulous!  No lens changes and the ability to really zoom in on faces and special moments is priceless!!

Reviews.Title: I love it!!!
Reviews.Author: Cardona "Aficionado a la Cocina"
Reviews.Content: It is a really good cam.  I wanted one cam for taking pictures of animals and flowers.  It works perfect.  The autofocus is perfect and fast.  The leica lens is perfect.  Very nice color.  Very light for traveling.

Reviews.Title: Best digital camera ever!
Reviews.Author: Shirlee J. Mcdaniels "Shirlee"
Reviews.Content: This Panasonic Lumix is the best digital camera I have ever used and this is my 3rd.

Reviews.Title: Great camera ,great price
Reviews.Author: Blue Baron
Reviews.Content: I have used 35mm SLR for years and wanted a small digital camera with most of the features of an SLR,including a fairly foolproof point and shoot mode.This camera Provided all that and more.The 18x zoom is awesomereplacing  the need for a huge SLR lens.I took the camera to Disney and several other locations and found it to be just what I needed.From action to night time fireworks this little camera did a great job.

Reviews.Title: panasonic, dmc-fz18
Reviews.Author: Ricardo Falcao Teti
Reviews.Content: Fantastic camera, receive a suggestion from a work mate and I was surprised when got camera in my hands, it is really excellent.

Reviews.Title: Great Camera
Reviews.Author: Mike Starman
Reviews.Content: This is an outstanding camera.  Great zoom, shoots in low lighting conditions. I cannot find anything to not like.

Reviews.Title: i'm very happy with this camera
Reviews.Author: José (Venezuela)
Reviews.Content: Is a great hybrid camera.  GREAT PICTURES, ZOOM, LIFE BATTERIES AND EASY TO USE.  Is a highly recomended product for the price.

Reviews.Title: Great Camera
Reviews.Author: YAYA
Reviews.Content: We are very impressed with this little camera.  For a reasonable amount of money we feel like we got it all.  We just got back from the Grand Canyon and the photos taken on "scenery" setting are very very good.  We also took pictures of our grandson in the Texas bluebonnets last week and they are fantastic.  The colors both far and near are very good.  The detail captured both in the original and the cropped for a close up after downloading is beautiful.  Action shots while skiing showed up perfectly...no blurry lines at all.  We are in our 50's and love the large LCD screen as well as the ability to look thru the viewfinder and adjust it to correct our vision.  Battery life is escellent.The only negative thing we have found is it doesn't come with a card so we had to spend another 35.00 for a card...no big deal. And the instruction book is worded somewhat oddly so you have to read it carefully if you are trying to figure out something more difficult than point and shoot.We have shown the photos to family and friends and all ready have 2 people ordering this camera.

Reviews.Title: That was what I was dreaming of!
Reviews.Author: Uður Aral "LARA ARAL"
Reviews.Content: I have searched about this camera for a month. There were three other cameras that I thought to buy and these were in the same segment too. Of course I have nothing to say about the others but I am very pleased of buying this camera. This is much better than I expected. I will add my first picture which is the half moon. Please see it and decide whether it is satisfactory for you. This is too good for an amateour who wants to learn the secrets of good photgraphing and basics of dSLR machines. I will highly recomend this machine to people right after the beginer level.Ugur ARAL

Reviews.Title: Great outdoor camera!
Reviews.Author: aka Sophia
Reviews.Content: This is my 4th digital camera.  I've had it for about a month now and have thoroughly enjoyed figuring out all the features. I was mostly interested in purchasing something for landscape photography. I read tons of reviews on various super-zooms. This one consistently had the best overall reviews, particular with its ability to take great outdoor shots. The reviews were right-on... it takes beautiful outdoor pictures. Night shots are challenging (thus the 4star rating).  Does a great job with the video feature. It's small and very light. Over all I'm pretty happy with this camera.

Reviews.Title: Fantastic camera
Reviews.Author: S. Swaenepoel "Shirley"
Reviews.Content: This camera is all I hoped it would be. It is easy to use, even for a beginner, and it takes great pictures.

Reviews.Title: Performs better than expected
Reviews.Author: Gar Del Savio
Reviews.Content: After reading reviews about this camera and it's difficulty shooting pictures in low light I was surprised how well this camera performs shooting available light pictures.  The picture stabilization feature works very well and the photo prints are great

Reviews.Title: Best for the Money
Reviews.Author: SkiBum "SkiBum"
Reviews.Content: I've only owned this camera a few weeks, but I have never had a camera take such consistently sharp, well exposed pictures.  This camera functions perfectly under almost any light condition and its versatility equals most any DSLR.  What I appreciate as much as anything is the fact that it gives you a true wide angle (28mm equiv.) which I use the most, but the 18X telephoto (504mm equiv.) is really great for wildlife especially with the flawless image stabilization.  If this camera has any faults, I certainly haven't been able to find them.

Reviews.Title: One of the Best!!!!
Reviews.Author: Alex Urena
Reviews.Content: This is my second Lumix from Panasonic, it does not get any better. Simple to use and fantastic results!!!

Reviews.Title: panasonic lumix fz-18
Reviews.Author: Steven G. Laiken "tompte"
Reviews.Content: After taking picture, it takes too long before camera is ready to take next picture. Currently shooting in jpg + raw.  unable to turn off raw without deleting jpg.  Also, we use msn premium [as part of verizon]. pictures from this camera are incompatible with msn premium.  bummer.we're looking into correcting email incompatibility. [[ software supplied with camera a little disappointing ]]but, i'm still learning. light weight of camera is enjoyable; manual settings and 18x zoom are nice.

Reviews.Title: Disappointment
Reviews.Author: Carol S "songbird"
Reviews.Content: Budget wise couldn't acquire an SLR, so checked out the Sony 15X, the Olympus 18X, and the Fuji 18X beforedeciding on the Panasonic DMC-FZ18K.If you want to take landscapes, people, buildings it is an excellent camera with the Leica lens. It's all the specks say it is. BUT if you take flying birds, moving animals and wildllifeforget it.. When you try to pan and snap the shutter is so slow that the object is out of the focus by the time it snaps.  Had a chance to take some great  shots of an eagle soaring over a river below me.  (They are rare in my area). What a disappointment! . I catch deer, wild turkeys, raptors with my 12X Canon S3IS

Reviews.Title: good buy
Reviews.Author: Manju Sharma
Reviews.Content: This Lumix camera is more than worth the money. Lens is very good. If you want to see the photo, you just took, it is a slow process. That is the only drawback I feel and should be corrected.

Reviews.Title: Virtually unused
Reviews.Author: Robert C. Vespa
Reviews.Content: The only compromise was its not having a lens hood (which came with the one I was replacing), and I just assumed it was part of any camera.

Reviews.Title: Despite having a trigger shutter remote
Reviews.Author: nylene angell
Reviews.Content: in the manual, it is impossible to use a remote shutter trigger with this camera :(  If one existed this camera would be my everything camera.

Reviews.Title: Great camera
Reviews.Author: Gene Fout "Blinks"
Reviews.Content: I got this camera for me to take hunting.Love the features so does my wife, she now has it,will have to get another for myself.I have owned about six different brands of cameras.I will never get any more unless I get one of these.It is one great camera after you learn how to use it.The only thing I don't about it is the lens cap comes off real easy, but small price to pay for great camera.

Reviews.Title: Good for the money
Reviews.Author: Eduard Zaharia
Reviews.Content: This camera was purchased as a gift, i just tested for the dead pixels, I could not find any one wich is very good and by the way is made in Japan. About IQ you can look in internet. I think is a good camera for that price (300$).

Reviews.Title: Panasonic Lumix DMC-FZ18K 8.1MP Digital Camera with 18x Wide Angle
Reviews.Author: RGZ "rgz"
Reviews.Content: We are happy to use this camera. This is not a professional one, but anyway better than small camera.Has RAW, and certainly 18x zoom + by 4 digital zoom is very cool!I think this is the best in "like-DSLR"

Reviews.Title: new lumix
Reviews.Author: James L. Anderson

Reviews.Author: mickeycat
Reviews.Content: Wanting a small, lightweight digital camera with 18x zoom and an optical viewfinder, this camera fit the bill.  It offers many features for a good price.  Photos are good quality and would recommend for the casual user who wants the extra zoom capability.

Reviews.Title: Panasonic Super Zoom
Reviews.Author: Edward D. Ostroff
Reviews.Content: A very capable digital camera with 18 to 1 zoom and easy interface plus image stabilization. It is simple to use and performs well. The price was right.

Reviews.Title: great camera
Reviews.Author: jno
Reviews.Content: I used it during my holidays in Turkey. Very lightweight for hiking. Also I can used it inside museum as Santa Sophia basilic where flash is forbidden to take details of mosaic.

When i started using with full zoom in iE mode still it is blurry.Still i like it i can cover big land scape and buildings. For this price its good to get this camera

Reviews.Title: A very versatile P&S;
Reviews.Author: Stephen
Reviews.Content: I got this camera for a week and so far quite satisfied with it. It's a very versatile 18x mega zoom P&S.; Combine with the effective optical image stabilizer, I can shoot sports from very far distance. It's very good for a family trip and almost able to handle any situation. The iA function works very well. One can also grow the photographic skill with it.One thing need to mention is the image quality is not very fantastic. Do not try to compare it with DSLR or even good P&S.; It's just good enough to view on the monitor and make small print.

Reviews.Title: Brilliant camera
Reviews.Author: Timothy D. Paul
Reviews.Content: This is really a wonderful camera for the money. The colour saturation, sharpness of focus, great manual controls all makes this a brilliant digital experience. If I have one complaint it is that it's a little noisy in low light, be better is the CCD was a bit larger or the pixel count lower. Still, not so much of an issue that I would rate the camera lower than I have.

Reviews.Title: Very good camera!
Reviews.Author: Stas Bervyachonok
Reviews.Content: Very satisfied with this camera after using IXUS 400 for about four years.Easy to handle, easy menu. Powerful lens. RAW format is VERY useful.Best value for money!

Reviews.Title: Tops in class
Reviews.Author: Robert J. Barber
Reviews.Content: This camera is good as they come, with the advantage of the wide angle to 18x who could ask for more even at twice the price. The only con: the camera would be even better if it came with the adjustable viewer that some others in class do.

Reviews.Title: Great on paper
Reviews.Author: Adam Ansels "Nature Photog"
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera recently because of a great price $249.00 delivered.That was the good news.Although on paper it should be a very good camera, it was a disappointment.  I have been shooting Sony H series for a couple of years.  I do nature in good lighting & need a good auto mode camera that can be hand held.  The H5 is good but the H2 is unbelievable.  Thought that the FZ18 would be good with its 18x Leica lens system but you really have to play with the camera to get acceptable pictures.  The auto mode is almost useless for me.  If you like to set program settings & custom settings then you'll have a great time.BTW the camera does not let you use the zoom in the movie mode!  Just sold it on Craig's list & am buying another H2 as backup.

Reviews.Title: Would be a great camera but it's a dust magnet
Reviews.Author: Billy Baloney
Reviews.Content: This camera was great in most of the ways the 5-star reviews here say it is.  I don't know if maybe mine was just a lemon but it had dust on the CCD right out of the box which ruined my pics of an air show I attended.  I sent it to Vann's for service and they sent it back to me about a month later without even fixing it.  I'll never again do business with a dishonest outfit like Vann's.  Anyway, I sent the camera to Panasonic to get fixed under the warranty and they sent it back in 3 days, perfectly clean.  I kept it in a clean camera bag, lens down for a few months until the next summer and, sure enough, I had more dust on the CCD which ruined my vacation photos.  Took it to a local camera shop which charged $60 to take it apart and clean the CCD.  Two weeks later, more CCD dust, more ruined photos.  This camera brought me a years worth of grief, frustration and ruined photos of once-in-a-lifetime experiences.  I won't buy a Panasonic camera again and I hope Vann's goes out of business.

Reviews.Title: Almost Perfect
Reviews.Author: Richard Glaser
Reviews.Content: The features on this Panasonic FZ18 are fantastic. It's my new walk around camera.My only concern is Noise.  Panasonic should address this issue.

Reviews.Author: M. Cyzio "marektoja"
Reviews.Content: Produces superior pictures under very good light conditions. But higher ISO modes are VERY noisy. Reviews.Title: Pessimistic view! ;)
Reviews.Author: Spanky
Reviews.Content: OK boys and girls. Get it. Stay away from unknown sellers who are not know for easy returns!First, who shouldn't get it? If you are a pixel peeper (like me) *and* you are also going to feel small because there's noise on the dime sized parts of your subject. No one will even notice; unless you have a poster made and/or when compared to a Nikon ($2500) D300 or Canon 40D and at 800 ISO in low light and with no-flash allowed and fast movement. Then this may not be the right camera for you. Neither then, would any point and shooter. See DSLRs and get out your wallet.So soccer mom's WITH dim(Sun is OK) and zero flash restrictions might want to pass. Plus, (no-flash) dinner party snappers might look elsewhere, as well. You don't need the long zoom (Focal Length) around the dinner table. But don't think you will fair much better with a point and shooter, unless you spend MORE than the FZ18 costs, and find yourself a Fuji F31FD (or F30). The F40 isn't as good (low light) but you might like it with SD cards. No! These are still not better than just about any DSLR for low light, but they are pocket-able. These Fuji's also require some tweaking for the bright sun (they are so good at low light) so be prepared. These little compacts (if you can find one of the overpriced things) also do not have many of the niceties that one may enjoy with the FZ18. Such as a better motor; menu, etc. They use the dreaded xD.So, since we're being pessimistic, what would you miss if you got a DSLR instead (get both if you please.) Well besides Two to Fourteen times more cash, you'd lose movie mode and at 16:9 through the extremely high quality Leica (Say "Like-ah". You're welcome) lens system (Combined 28mm to 803mm equivalent). Do you know how much a DSLR lens, that does 70-300 (400mm equiv) at F4 (on the long end) costs; by it's self? You can do 504mm at about F4 (with adequate light.) 803mm if you have a large, view filling subject and use 3M (Mega pixel) Extended Zoom (EZ).Then there's weight. A lot more with DSLR's. More size too. bigger bag.Do you like a live view? The new live view DSLRs do not work the same.Would you like zero dust entering your camera?So, you can't take picture in the near dark (well, there is High Sensitivity mode but it's a pixelated toy. You can get a bright shot; in the extreme dim though.) Yet a DSLR camera can not go from really wide 28mm(with little distortion) and also up to 803mm zoom (with also little artifacts and the purple fringing eliminated) in an instant, without a pile of cash and someone to help you carry (and switch) the lens and a DSLR can't do all this in 848x480 (16:9) movie mode, given pausing between zooms.Yet, if someone would like to send me a free DSLR, I will suffer. :P Meanwhile, I'm running out of excuses to get anything more expensive than my FZ18.I have to agree. It seems to me, DSLR cameras are a racket. An expensive one. Please demand lower cost. Just think about what would happen to the DSLR market; if a camera like the FZ18 had a little sensor with the abilities of the Fuji F30 compact. Maybe it's time to stop saying "mine is longer and bigger". Keep your wallet in your pants until things improve. That will get some attention. What would be out of place, to have a "pro" camera, like the FZ18?Nothing is perfect but the FZ18 gets overall the closest.

Reviews.Title: Buena relación calidad-precio
Reviews.Author: Luis
Reviews.Content: Hablaré primero de la parte externa de la cámara. Buena óptica, disposición de botones y rápido acceso al menú a través del joistck. Se hace notar la excesiva presencia de plástico pero de muy buena calidad que da solidez al tacto.La pantalla LCD de muy buena resolución con opciones de ajustes de brillo no siendo así el visor que presenta pequeñas distorsiones a los costados aunque muchas veces inapreciables.Muchos han criticado el lugar de la tarjeta de memoria pero para mi no presenta problemas que se encuentre a lado de la batería que por cierto esta ultima posee un buen rendimiento de energía que esta sujeto al uso que damos a la cámara como es común en las digitales. El flash responde muy bien a las configuraciones de exposición aunque no se porque Panasonic no incluyo una zapata para flashes externo.Calidad de imagen, como ya sabemos el tema del ruido sigue presente, en esta cámara a partir de los 400 ISO es verdaderamente molesto para los mas exigentes aunque algunas personas ni lo notan, ISO mas altos son imposible de utilizar debido al excesivo ruido. Tiene capacidad de guardar las fotos en RAW que para muchos es muy importante.  Algo que si cabe destacar es la estabilización de imagen de la lente Leica, realmente funciona bien con el zoom al máximo. El auto foco es preciso y cuenta con el enfoque manual para ayudar en situaciones en las que no puede enfocar.En general, buenísima cámara y esta acorde al precio.Por favor, no olviden que es una compacta de gama alta, controles manuales, algunos que otros ajustes, buena óptica y otras prestaciones. Si te gusta la fotografía pero no te dedicas a ella y estas empezando en este mundo es una cámara muy adecuada y la recomiendo.Es mi humilde crítica.

Reviews.Title: Question about this camera
Reviews.Author: Ale "Ale"
Reviews.Content: We got this camera some weeks ago.I am reading reviews and now know it's not a point and shoot camera and I understand that.However, I have been learning how to use it and try the different settings to try to take better pictures. It seems to me it's sort of hard to take good pictures inside (low-light conditions) in the intelligent auto mode. I read reviews saying good things about the IAM mode. But in my case it gives me noisy pictures. We took pictures without flash inside (lights inside were on) and the skin color in people look way red and it's like the same red from skin covered places like shirt sleeves and such.I have also found out, the zoom is great and it clearly controls the jittering when you are zooming a lot. But other than that, I dont seem to find a setting I can use for when I need to take a good picture (good quality) and I dont have much time to think which setting or scene mode to use. The quality when putting the pictures in my computer doesnt seem to be the best, even the picture size is set to 8M.  If you zoom in to the picture in the computer, the pixelation is a lot.Do you have any comments on this? do you agree? I need some feedback.I want to know if this are drawbacks of the camera, or if I am just not suitable for a camera this complicated. Thanks!

Reviews.Title: Just not up to par and poor warranty service
Reviews.Author: Moira Ashleigh "Graphic designer"
Reviews.Content: I was so in love with my TZ1, when I went up a level I chose this camera. There are some good things: battery life is great, shoots RAW images, huge zoom, and the weight isn't too bad.But I am disappointed in Panasonic. The shutter repeat is slow so if you don't get the first shot, forget about it with wild life. The image stabilization is lacking, hence a lot of lost shots for blurry images. It often chooses the closest item as the dominant image not using the item I tell it to focus on, and no I am not using the "intelligent focus". The image backgrounds are not as clear as my old TZ1.But my TZ1 is in warranty hell with Panasonic. I sent my TZ1 in to the warranty service center 4 weeks ago. It was ready last week but the service center is too busy to return it. I was told Friday that they completed repair but were too busy to ship it out, I was told Monday that they were very busy and would call when it was shipped - no call yet. Looks to me like they are intentionally running out my warranty. So this is a warning about Panasonic warranty service.I have 2 Panasonic cameras now but after this would probably not get another.Moira

Reviews.Title: SO DISAPPOINTED
Reviews.Author: itzmelindal
Reviews.Content: I have an SLR and love it but like a lot of other folks needed something smaller and less cumbersome that I could carry in my purse. I liked the higher mega pixels and the 18x zoom on this camera.I loved the idea of such a great zoom but you really HAVE  to use a tripod or the pictures are unusable because of the blur. So much for less cumbersome. In fact that is my main disappointment and complaint about this camera is the blurring issue if I am using the zoom at all.Would'a, Could'a, Should'a opted for something with less zoom and better more reliable picture quality!

Reviews.Title: Very satisfied....
Reviews.Author: Murat Nal "M UNAL"
Reviews.Content: I took it yesterday in my hands(from Amazon and 6ave). I am still learning period, but very satisfied the features; build quality, fast operation, 18x zoom, wild angle and IA mode. Only one critism is noise in the low light pictures.

Reviews.Title: Casi perfecta..!! (4.5 estrellas)
Reviews.Author: Jose Bautista Valle
Reviews.Content: Excelente camara... estabilizacion casi perfecta, increible zoom (sobretodo mas de 28x con 3MP o menos). Facil de configurar. Todo lo q se pedir de una camara semiprofesional. NO le doy 5 estrellas por 2 motivos: primero, el flash incorporado es muy tenue en situaciones de poca luz, las imagenes salen oscuras a mas d 3 metros de distancia y al aumentarle el ISO produce algo de ruido (como la mayoria de las semiprofesionales de gran zoom), y segundo, mientras se filma no se puede utilizar el zoom, ni optico ni digital (al menos no lo he logrado hacer, aun no he revisado bien esos detalles). Por lo demas, una excelente camara.
